eng: He that says a, should also say b.
hun_orig: Aki á-t mond, mondjon bé-t is.

eng: If something is given to you then take it, if you are beaten, then run away.
hun_orig: Ha adnak, vedd el, ha ütnek, szaladj el.

eng: It is better to give than to receive.
He gives twice who gives quickly.
Like greeting, on arrival, like answer.
hun_orig: Amilyen az adjonisten, olyan a fogadjisten.

eng: Backwards with the greyhounds.
eng_explain: 'Be more modest!'

eng: As one makes his bed, so he sleeps his dream.
hun_orig: Ki mint veti ágyát, úgy alussza álmát.

eng: He shoots at sparrows with a high calibre gun.
Do not look at the tooth of a gift horse.
hun_orig: Ajándék lónak ne nézd a fogát.

eng: He rushes into the house together with the door.
eng_explain: 'He tells/does something to somebody without announcement.'

eng: If he is thrown out through the door, he enters through the window.
hun_orig: Ha kidobják az ajtón, bemegy az ablakon.

eng: One should act as he may, not as he would like to.
hun_orig: Nem amint akarnánk, hanem amint lehet.

eng: He would not deserve even the rope for hanging.
hun_orig: Csak akasztásra való istrángot sem érdemelne.

eng: He whose place is on the gallows, will not die in the Danube.
hun_orig: Kinek akasztófa helye, nem hal a Dunába.

eng: He names a rope in the house of a man that was hanged.
Opportunity bears the thief.
He has stirred up (or threw a stone into) still water.
eng_explain: 'He brought motion in a quiet life.'

eng: The apple does not fall far from its tree.
hun_orig: Nem esik messze az alma a fájától.

eng: We are not angels.
Like mother, like daughter.
hun_orig: Amilyen az anya, olyan a leánya.

eng: Have a close look at the mother and then marry her daughter.
hun_orig: Nézd meg az anyját, vedd el a lányát.

eng: It is difficult to swim against the stream.
He who cannot speak Arabic, should not speak Arabic.
eng_explain: 'He who has no knowledge/understanding of something, should not engage in (or interfere with) it.'
hun_orig: Aki nem tud arabusul, ne beszéljen arabusul.

eng: Gold is gold even in the mud.
hun_orig: Az arany a sárban is arany.

eng: To be silent is golden (to speak is silver).
All is not gold that glitters.
He who gets up early finds gold.
Rust cannot do any harm to gold.
eng_explain: 'A man of character is resistant to temptation.'

eng: A golden key fits every door.
Not always that reaps who sows.
hun_orig: Nem mindig az arat, aki vet.

eng: This is not my table.
eng_explain: 'This is not my duty/responsibility/concern.'

eng: Three women (A goose and two women) make a whole fair.
hun_orig: Három asszony (egy lúd, két asszony), egész vásár.

eng: A good wife is the crown of the house.
A busy women has a lazy daughter, a lazy women has a busy daughter.
hun_orig: Serény asszonynak rest a lánya, rest asszonynak serény a lánya.

eng: Believe in women as in the weather in April.
hun_orig: Higgy az asszonynépnek, mint az áprilisi időjárásnak.

eng: It is easy to collect ears of corn under/beside a stack.
hun_orig: Könnyű az asztag alatt/mellett kalászt szedni.

eng: We do not play 'Return the dolls clothes'.
eng_explain: 'I do not agree to cancel a promise/agreement or to return a present given by him.'

eng: Among many midwives the child is lost.
hun_orig: Sok bába közt elvész a gyerek.

eng: The stake of the play is not beans.
eng_explain: 'It is a serious matter.'

eng: Even an owl is a judge in her cave.
The owl tells the sparrow that her head is big.
Trouble does not come alone.
Everyone his own trouble.
He is flaying the same bock.
eng_explain: (He sings the same old song.)

eng: Accidents may happen to anyone.
He has slipped on a banana-peel.
eng_explain: 'By making a small error his secret/illegal activity came into the open.'

eng: A late repentance is a dogs idea.
eng_explain: (After death the doctor.)

eng: Luck brings friends, need tries them.
Tell me who your friend is, I'll tell you who you are.
hun_orig: Mondd meg, ki a barátod megmondom ki vagy.

eng: All are not your friends who smile at you.
hun_orig: Nem mind barátod, aki rád mosolyog.

eng: His courage sank to his sinews.
eng_explain: 'He got frightened.'

eng: Luck belongs to the brave.
It is below the bottom of a frog.
eng_explain: 'It is of inferior quality.'

eng: He swallows the frog.
eng_explain: 'He swallows the bitter pill.'

eng: Leave others in peace, care for yourself.
hun_orig: Hagyj békét másnak, magadra viselj gondot.

eng: Peace is better.
eng_explain: 'It is better to refrain from quarrels/contradictions or raising/forcing an argument.'

eng: Like Barnard, he tries to catch the 'heaven's stone' (i. e. the lightning).
eng_explain: He acts in confusion, inconsistently.

eng: He succeeded like Bertók with the loach.
eng_explain: 'He lost everything.'
hun_orig: Nyert benne, mint Bertók a csíkban.

eng: In much talk there is much "bottom" (i. e. inferior matter).
The former highwayman men are the best gendarmes.
hun_orig: A betyárból lesz a legjobb pandúr.

eng: His (pocket)-knife was broken in it.
eng_explain: 'He tried but failed in a achieving something.'

eng: The (pocket)-knife opens in my pocket.
eng_explain: 'Something has caused anger/despair but one was compelled to stand idly by.'

eng: He who is strongest/ablest can devour it.
eng_explain: 'The strongest/ablest wins.'

eng: It is taken by turns like village headmanship.
hun_orig: Sorba megy, mint a falusi bíróság.

eng: Where one trusts, there he gets fat.
He explains away his report.
eng_explain: 'He tries hard to explain or justify his action or behaviour.'

eng: He issues a certificate of poverty of himself.
eng_explain: 'He proves his incapacity.'

eng: There is thick sandal leather on his face.
eng_explain: 'He is bluntly shameless.'

eng: Like Mrs Bodó he talks about something else when asked to pay for the wine.
eng_explain: 'Side-stepping an issue.'
hun_orig: Mást beszél, mint Bodóné, mikor a bor árát kérik.

eng: Out of a foolish hole a foolish wind blows.
eng_explain: 'A fool can tell only foolish things.'

eng: A fool stumbles twice at the same stone.
Fortune favours the fool.
A fool may throw a stone into a well which a hundred wise cannot take out.
hun_orig: Egy bolond beledobja a kútba a követ, száz okos se veszi ki.

eng: One fool makes a hundred.
Wine in, sense out.
Good wine needs no signboard/bush.
He stares at the new gate as a calf.
eng_explain: 'He merely looks at something without taking action.'
hun_orig: Bámul, mint borjú az új kapura.

eng: He dances on a razor-edge.
eng_explain: 'He tries to face danger from two/more sides.'

eng: Pepper is small but strong.
He crushes pepper under the nose of somebody.
eng_explain: 'He annoys/irritates somebody.'
hun_orig: Borsot tör valakinek az orra alá.

eng: It is like peas thrown against the wall.
eng_explain: 'A vain effort.'

eng: They match as a stick in a quiver.
hun_orig: Úgy illik össze, mint bot a tegezbe.

eng: The "head" of each stick is at its end.
eng_explain: (Praise a fair day at night.)
hun_orig: Minden botnak a végén a feje.

eng: He who greets with a stick, will be answered with a club.
hun_orig: Aki bottal köszön, annak doronggal felelnek.

eng: His footprints can be beaten with a stick.
eng_explain: 'He managed to escape.'

eng: Nobody can slip out of his own skin.
eng_explain: 'Nobody can abandon easily his customs/ideas.'
hun_orig: Senki sem tud kibújni a saját bőréből.

eng: Every one carries his own skin to the market (i.e. acts at his own risk).
hun_orig: Mindenki a maga bőrét viszi a vásárra.

eng: He is one pamphlet behind the others.
eng_explain: 'He still thinks/speaks/acts according to the previous guidelines.'

eng: The castle of Buda was not built in one day.
hun_orig: Nem egy nap alatt épült Buda vára.

eng: These was a dog-market in Buda only once.
eng_explain: 'This favourable opportunity was a one-time occasion only.'

eng: He stumbled upwards.
eng_explain: 'After failing in a job he was moved to higher position.'

eng: The purpose consecrates the means.
Every gypsy prises his own horse.
hun_orig: Minden cigány a maga lovát dicséri.

eng: The gypsy is not accustomed to ploughing.
eng_explain: 'He is compelled to do something, he was previously reluctant to do.'
hun_orig: Nem szokta a cigány a szántást.

eng: Even if gypsy children are dropped from the sky.
eng_explain: (Come hell or high water.)
hun_orig: Még ha cigánygyerekek potyognak/esnek is az égből.

eng: He considers it as straw of the landowner Csáky.
eng_explain: 'An expression of negligence instead of due care.'

eng: The sky's stone does not strike the nettle.
eng_explain: (Weeds don't spoil.)

eng: Give the emperor what is the emperor's and God what is God's.
eng_explain: 'Give everyone his due.'
hun_orig: Add meg a császárnak, ami a császáré, és az Istennek, ami az Istené.

eng: They have buried the hatchet.
Many drops hollow the stone.
There is a tile on the roof.
eng_explain: (Walls have ears.)
hun_explain: (Fiatal/gyerek van jelen, ill. "a falnak is füle van.")

eng: To an earthenware dish a wooden spoon.
eng_explain: 'Marry your match.'

eng: He would even lie, there is no star in the sky.
eng_explain: 'He is ready to deny even the most obvious truths.'

eng: If we do nothing (without being ordered to do) no trouble will result from it.
hun_orig: Ha nem csinálok semmit, abból nem lehet baj.

eng: I would not wipe my muddy boots in him.
eng_explain: 'An expression of utter despise.'
hun_orig: A sáros csizmámat sem törölném hozzá.

eng: How could the boots get on the table?
eng_explain: 'What has that got to do with it?'
hun_orig: Hogy kerül a csizma az asztalra?

eng: Every wonder lasts three days.
This is already a gnawed bone.
eng_explain: 'A matter already discussed several times.'

eng: He who comes late gets bones for lunch.
If it does not trickle, it will drop.
eng_explain: 'Even if it is less than expected, still there will be something.'

eng: He got out of the bucket and got into the pail.
eng_explain: (Out of the frying into the fire.)

eng: A little pot quickly boils.
He puts his hand into a wasp's nest.
He would spend even the treasures of Darius.
Even you are not better than the linen of Deak's wife.
eng_explain: 'You are as bad as the others.'
hun_orig: Te sem vagy jobb a Deákné vásznánál.

eng: The hoar-frost is still to come for the dog.
eng_explain: 'Be sure your sins will find you out!'

eng: A three day long merry-making and regret lasting till death.
eng_explain: 'A hasty marriage.'
hun_orig: Három napig dínomdánom, holtig való szánom bánom.

eng: A nut is good if broken, a woman if beaten.
hun_orig: A dió törve, az asszony verve jó.

eng: He keeps silent, like a deaf pig in the wheat-field.
hun_orig: Hallgat, mint a süket disznó a búzában.

eng: A hungry pig dreams of acorns.
A clever pig extracts a deep root.
eng_explain: 'A clever man achieves remarkable feats.'

eng: Do not waste your ginger on pigs.
Nobody is forced to attend the dinner given after killing a pig.
eng_explain: 'You are free to refrain from accepting an offer I consider favourable to/for you.'

eng: Sparrows cannot be caught by beating a drum.
He who works has no time to earn money.
eng_explain: 'If a job is hard and little paid, then one cannot earn additionally in a second job.'
hun_orig: Aki dolgozik, az nem ér rá pénzt keresni.

eng: He that does not work, shall not eat either.
hun_orig: Aki nem dolgozik, ne is egyék.

eng: To pull somebody by a wire.
eng_explain: (To pull the strings.)

eng: Two pipers cannot get on in one tavern.
hun_orig: Két dudás egy csárdában nem fér meg.

eng: It will happen when the Danube reverts its course or dries up.
hun_orig: Akkor lészen az, mikor a Duna visszafoly vagy elszárad.

eng: The Danube could be dammed by them.
eng_explain: 'There are too many of them.'

eng: Two dogs can hardly agree on one bone.
hun_orig: Nehezen alkuszik meg két eb egy csonton.

eng: It fell to the thirtieth of dogs.
eng_explain: 'Although it is valuable nobody cares for it any more.'

eng: Gnawing on bones is for dogs having teeth.
If a dog is driven by a stick after a hare, he will not catch it.
hun_orig: Ha egy ebet bottal hajtanak a nyúl után, nem fogja az meg.

eng: He ties the dog to the post.
eng_explain: 'He sticks to his position/plan/idea.'

eng: A dogs broken bone will soon be healed.
eng_explain: 'The wound inflicted will soon be healed.'

eng: The difference between them is like that between sky and earth.
Like a thunderstroke from a clear sky.
The flavour of health is given by an illness.
hun_orig: Az egészség ízét a betegség adja meg.

eng: The congregation is poor, the priest rings the bell himself.
hun_orig: Szegény az eklézsia, maga harangoz a pap.

eng: An elephant in the china shop.
We do not live to eat, but we eat to live.
hun_orig: Nem azért élünk, hogy együnk, hanem azért eszünk, hogy éljünk.

eng: He who is conceited, will easily be ashamed.
Neither be conceited, nor fall into despair.
hun_orig: Se el ne hidd/bízd magad, se kétségbe ne essél.

eng: Life is beautiful if it is hectic.
hun_orig: Akkor/Úgy szép az élet, ha zajlik.

eng: I do not want it even for my enemy.
He who is not against us, that is with us.
hun_orig: Aki nincs ellenünk, az velünk van.

eng: What's gone, is gone.
eng_explain: (Don't cry over spilt milk.)

eng: As many men as many opinions.
One cannot be cautious enough.
hun_orig: Az ember nem lehet elég óvatos.

eng: Man is a wolf to man.
Man plans, God decides.
Man hopes until his death.
One does not know what he will find tomorrow.
hun_orig: Nem tudja az ember, mire virrad.

eng: Many good people can find room in a small space.
hun_orig: Sok jó ember elfér kis helyen.

eng: You do not needed a basket to pick well-known strawberries (those living nearby or being quicker have already picked them).
hun_orig: Híres eperre nem kell kosárral menni (a közelebb lakók vagy szemfülesebbek már leszedték rég).

eng: He won't pick strawberries into the basket of somebody else.
The forest has an ear, the field has an eye.
hun_orig: Az erdőnek füle van, a mezőnek szeme van.

eng: As it falls so it plumps.
eng_explain: (As the tree falls, it will lie.)

eng: After rain (comes) raincoat.
eng_explain: (After meat, mustard.)

eng: A rain in May is golden.
One should/could do more by wisdom than by force.
He may eat it or not, he won't get anything else.
hun_orig: Eszi, nem eszi, nem kap mást.

eng: He does not even know whether it is eaten or drunk.
eng_explain: 'He has no idea about it.'
hun_orig: Azt se tudja, eszik-e vagy isszák.

eng: Many Eskimos and few seals.
There is no worthless thing which could not be used something.
hun_orig: Nincs olyan hitvány eszköz, hogy hasznát ne lehetne venni.

eng: Appetite comes while eating.
hun_orig: Evés közben jön meg az étvágy.

eng: This is (what we have/experience), this is to be liked.
Like tree, like fruit.
hun_orig: Amilyen a fa, olyan a gyümölcse.

eng: He cut his axe into a big tree.
eng_explain: (A hard venture.)

eng: An iron ring made of wood.
eng_explain: 'An absurdity.'

eng: He was carved of hard wood.
eng_explain: 'He is strong/steadfast.'

eng: Even a good tree has (sometimes) bad fruit.
hun_orig: Jó fának is van rossz gyümölcse.

eng: A tree is not felled at one stroke.
hun_orig: A fát nem vágják ki egy csapásra/vágásra.

eng: Bend the tree while it is a twig.
hun_orig: Addig hajtsd a fát, míg vessző.

eng: He cuts the tree under himself.
He has put bad wood on the fire.
eng_explain: (He has got into mischief.)

eng: He cannot see the wood for the trees.
hun_orig: Nem látja a fától az erdőt.

eng: The trees do not grow up to the sky.
hun_orig: Nem nőnek a fák az égig.

eng: The horse has to pull as the horse is also pulled.
eng_explain: 'He who gets orders from his superiors, has to pass them on to his subordinates.'
hun_explain: (Akitől az elöljárói megkövetelnek valamit, az is kénytelen követelni a beosztottaitól.)
hun_orig: A fakónak muszáj húzni, mert a fakót is húzzák.

eng: Even the wall has an ear.
The wolf may change its hair but not its nature.
eng_explain: (The wolf may lose his teeth, but never his nature/memory.) *
hun_orig: A farkas a szőrét elhányja, de a szokását nem.

eng: When a wolf is mentioned, he is already walking round the garden.
hun_orig: Farkast emlegetnek, a kert alatt kullog/jár.

eng: The wolf/dog does not eat the winter.
hun_orig: Nem eszi meg a farkas/kutya a telet.

eng: The tail wags the dog.
eng_explain: 'The normal order is reversed, e. g. those give orders who are expected to obey.'

eng: A new pot retains its first scent.
eng_explain: (The cask savours of the first fill.)
hun_orig: Az új fazék megtartja első szagát.

eng: Every man kindles the fire below his own pot.
hun_explain: (Minden szentnek maga felé hajlik a keze.)
hun_orig: Minden ember az ő maga fazeka mellé szít.

eng: One swallow does not make a summer.
He who has not (enough wit) in the head, should have (force, to replace it) in the leg.
hun_orig: Akinek nincs a fejében, legyen a lábában.

eng: He hits the nail on the head.
The waves dash over his head.
eng_explain: 'He is unable to cope with the situation any longer.'
hun_orig: Összecsapnak a feje fölött a hullámok.

eng: A bent head is not touched by the sword.
hun_orig: Lehajtott fejet nem éri a kard.

eng: There is no point in running one's head against the wall.
hun_orig: Nem jó fejjel menni/rohanni a falnak.

eng: The helve of the lost hatchet.
eng_explain: 'A little gain in a great loss.'

eng: It is better to fear (something) than to get frightened.
Better to return from half-way than to take a wrong road.
hun_orig: Jobb félútról visszatérni, mint rossz útra térni.

eng: Let the wormy of it drop off.
eng_explain: 'Let those perish/leave who are not up to the standard.'

eng: It is better to get fillérs often than forints seldom.
hun_orig: Jobb a sűrű fillér, mint a ritka forint.

eng: Until we are only poorly paid, we shall also poorly work.
hun_orig: Amíg nekünk csak fizetgetnek, addig mi is csak dolgozgatunk.

eng: He who has a toothache, should keep/hold his tongue on it.
eng_explain: 'Help yourself.'
hun_orig: Akinek a foga fáj, tartsa a nyelvét rajta.

eng: He whets his teeth on something.
eng_explain: 'He is very eager to get something.'

eng: He shows the whiteness of his teeth.
eng_explain: (He shows himself in his true colours.)

eng: Let us take it (into our hands) and then you carry it!
eng_explain: 'Somebody is urging others to work without wishing to take part in it.'

eng: The thread/string/rope breaks where it is thinnest.
hun_orig: Ott szakad a fonal/madzag/kötél, ahol a legvékonyabb.

eng: He left for Földvár to sell boards.
eng_explain: 'He died.'

eng: What you have cooked, you should eat as well.
eng_explain: 'You have to take the responsibility for your action.'

eng: Running away is a shame, but it is useful.
In at one ear and out at the other.
hun_orig: Egyik fülén be, a másikon ki.

eng: It has neither an ear, nor a tail.
eng_explain: (It has neither rhyme nor reason.)

eng: Where there is smoke, there is fire.
hun_orig: Ahol füst van, ott tűz is van.

eng: It went into smoke.
eng_explain: 'Nothing was realised/achieved.'

eng: Its smoke is bigger than the flame.
eng_explain: 'It is not so serious.'
hun_orig: Nagyobb a füstje, mint a lángja.

eng: A roast pigeon will not fly into one's mouth.
hun_orig: Senkinek sem repül szájába a sült galamb.

eng: Where there are many masters the servant becomes mad.
hun_orig: Ahol sok a gazda, bolond a szolga.

eng: A clever master turns even a loss into a gain.
hun_orig: Az okos gazda a kárt is jóra fordítja.

eng: He reckons without his host.
The master's eye makes the animals fat.
He was snatched by the belt.
eng_explain: 'He could not resist the temptation of well-being in return for yielding from strict moral standards.'

eng: He makes someone else get he chestnut from the fire (glowing embers).
hun_orig: Mással kapartatja ki a gesztenyét a tűzből/parázsból.

eng: He sews the jacket to the button.
eng_explain: 'Something is made after having a negligible part of if only.'

eng: He danced bound hand and foot.
eng_explain: 'He tries hard but has very little freedom of movement or action.'

eng: Practice makes the master.
Coward people have no country (of their own).
A child, a drunkard and a fool tell the truth.
hun_orig: Gyermek, részeg, bolond mondják az igazat.

eng: The child is dead the godfathership has ended.
hun_orig: Meghalt a gyermek, oda a komaság.

eng: Small child - small trouble, big child - big trouble.
hun_orig: Kisgyerek - kis gond, nagy gyerek - nagy gond.

eng: One need not throw out the child with the bath-water.
hun_orig: Nem kell a gyereket a fürdővízzel kiönteni.

eng: Even the mother cannot understand the words of a dumb child.
hun_orig: Néma gyereknek az anyja sem érti a szavát.

eng: Forbidden fruit is sweeter.
"Szolgálatban a rokonság/ismeretség nem számít."
eng_explain: In the army there is no Uncle Peter.
hun_orig: Nincs a hadban semmi Péter bátya.

eng: Long hair, short wit.
Rats desert a sinking ship.
hun_orig: A süllyedő hajót elhagyják a patkányok.

eng: They are rowing in the same ship.
eng_explain: (They are in then same boat.)

eng: The big fish eats the little fish.
hun_orig: A nagy hal megeszi a kis halat.

eng: Fish stinks from the head on.
There is no medicine against death.
He would be good for death.
eng_explain: 'He always arrives late.'

eng: Hear and see much, say little.
What we keep silence about, does not exist.
Silence (means) consent.
There will be no "funeral with songs" out of this/it.
eng_explain: 'This effort will end in failure.'

eng: It was needed as a Slovak glazier needed falling on his back.
eng_explain: 'A most unwanted event.'
hun_orig: Úgy kellett/hiányzott ez, mint ablakos/üveges tótnak a hanyattesés.

eng: Anger is a bad counsellor.
Postpone today's anger till tomorrow.
The dry leaves do not rustle if no wind blows.
eng_explain: (No smoke without fire.)
hun_orig: Nem zörög a haraszt, ha nem fúj a szél.

eng: The Hungarian justice is three.
eng_explain: 'E. g. One should drink three times.'

eng: Peel (the inner bark of) the lime tree until it peels.
eng_explain: (Strike the iron while it is hot.)
hun_orig: Addig hántsd a hársat/hársfát, míg hámlik.

eng: Fair words are not enough to an empty belly.
hun_orig: Üres hasnak nem elég a szép szó.

eng: I wish to see him when I see the middle of my back (i. e. never).
hun_orig: Akkor lássam, amikor a hátam közepét.

eng: The limits is the starlit sky.
eng_explain: 'There is no limit (e. g. in setting some prices).'

eng: There is a limit to everything.
So many houses, so many customs.
What was stolen by the house, will be returned by it.
eng_explain: 'Something mislaid somewhere will be found later.'
hun_orig: Amit a ház ellop, elő is adja.

eng: Many homes burn inside but it is not seen outside.
hun_orig: Sok ház ég belül, de nem látszik kívül.

eng: My house is my castle.
hun_orig: Az én házam az én váram.

eng: Each should sweep before his own house.
hun_orig: Mindenki a maga háza előtt söpörjön.

eng: He goes to see fire in the house.
eng_explain: 'A visit to the home of a future wife.'

eng: He that lies also steals.
He who once ventures to lie, deserves no more confidence.
hun_orig: Aki egyszer hazudni mer, többet hitelt nem érdemel.

eng: He lies as if he read from a book.
A liar is caught sooner than a lame dog.
hun_orig: A hazugot hamarabb utolérik, mint a sánta kutyát.

eng: A liar is not believed even if he tells the truth.
hun_orig: Akkor se hisznek a hazugnak, mikor igazat mond.

eng: Mountain does not meet mountain but man does meet man.
hun_orig: Hegy heggyel nem találkozik, de ember emberrel igen.

eng: Only those make no errors, who do not work at all.
hun_orig: Csak az nem követ el hibát, aki nem dolgozik.

eng: There are still (some) errors.
eng_explain: 'An answer to a complaint. It implies the refusal of the search for the reasons of the errors.'

eng: Bad news proceeds by wings, good news hardly walks.
hun_orig: A rossz hír szárnyon jár, a jó alig kullog.

eng: He who readily believes, will be readily disappointed.
Where is by now the snow of last year?
eng_explain: 'This is already past history (or out of date)!'
hun_orig: Hol van már a tavalyi hó?

eng: His snow-boots are full.
eng_explain: (He is fed up with the matter.)

eng: The hangman is being hanged.
eng_explain: 'Somebody has to undergo the same treatment he usually gives others.'

eng: A raven does not pick out raven's eye.
hun_orig: Holló a hollónak nem vájja ki a szemét.

eng: Who knows what tomorrow will bring.
hun_orig: Ki tudja, mit hoz a holnap.

eng: Speak praises or nothing of the dead.
hun_orig: A holtakról vagy jót vagy semmit.

eng: Hopp (i. e. wasting) at one time, kopp (hunger, want) at another.
An empty barrel sounds better.
Cheap meat yields dilute soup.
eng_explain: (Good cheap is dear.)

eng: Time passes, it waits for nobody.
hun_orig: Az idő eljár, senkire nem vár.

eng: Time is money.
He who gains time, gains life.
Everything has its time.
Tell the truth and your head will be broken.
In wine there is truth.
Truth cannot be hid under a bushel.
hun_orig: Az igazságot nem lehet véka alá rejteni.

eng: He who promises much, gives (but) little.
A promise is a nice word, if kept, then it is all right.
hun_orig: Az ígéret szép szó, ha megtartják úgy jó.

eng: The garret is full of promises.
eng_explain: 'I am fed up with promises.'

eng: Make no headache (for yourself) of what is not your business.
hun_orig: Ami téged nem illet, ne törd azon a fejedet.

eng: The soul is retained in it only by the prayer.
eng_explain: 'It is close to its end/destruction.'
hun_orig: Csak az imádság tartja benne a lelket.

eng: If it is not one's shirt, one should not put it on.
eng_explain: 'If a critical remark does not concern somebody, then it should be disregarded.'
hun_orig: Akinek nem inge, ne vegye magára.

eng: Do not trust even your own shirt.
Having no ointment and box why do you pose as hairdresser?
eng_explain: "Do not undertake something you are not equipped for."
hun_explain: "Nem vállalkozhatunk valamire, ha a hozzá szükségesekkel nem rendelkezünk."
hun_orig: Ha nincs íred és szelencéd, miért teszed magad borbéllyá?

eng: You'd better have one hundred who envy you than one who is sorry for you.
hun_orig: Jobb száz irigy, mint egy szánó.

eng: To whom God gives an office, adds also (or does not add) senses to it.
hun_orig: Akinek az Isten hivatalt ad, észt is ad (vagy észt nem ad) hozzá.

eng: What was given by God to one, cannot be taken away by man.
hun_orig: Akinek Isten valamit ad, ember el nem veheti.

eng: Even God/Christ our Lord has given way to a drunken man.
hun_orig: Az Isten/Krisztus urunk is kitért a részeg ember elől.

eng: Even God cannot satisfy everyone.
hun_orig: Az Isten se tehet mindennek eleget.

eng: God neither hurries, nor is late.
hun_orig: Az Isten sem siet, sem késik.

eng: God has taken him to a high position.
eng_explain: 'He got into well-being or a high position.'

eng: The mills of God grind slowly, but surely.
hun_orig: Isten malmai lassan őrölnek, de biztosan.

eng: God does not beat one with a stick.
He has caught the leg of God.
eng_explain: 'His actions have led him into a very favourable position.'

eng: He respects neither God, nor man.
hun_orig: Nem ismer se Istent, se embert.

eng: Help yourself and the God will also help you.
hun_orig: Segíts magadon, az Isten is megsegít.

eng: It is long as the songs of St. John's day. (Midsummer day's song.)
hun_orig: Olyan hosszú, mint a Szent Iván éneke.

eng: Tastes and slaps are different.
eng_explain: (Tastes differ.)

eng: He can live even on flat ice.
eng_explain: (He can get money in desert.)

eng: He who is good, gets his deserved punishment.
eng_explain: 'A good deed often does not get its due reward or is even followed by punishment by those who dislike it.'

eng: All is well if the end is well.
hun_orig: Minden jó, ha a vége jó.

eng: It is good everywhere, but it is the best at home.
In every good thing there is something bad.
Even of a good thing too much is harmful.
Anything done willingly is not hard/difficult to do.
hun_orig: Amit jókedvvel teszel, nem esik nehezedre.

eng: Everything is good as it is.
hun_orig: Minden úgy van jól, ahogy van.

eng: You should not only know what is right but also do it.
hun_orig: Ne csak tudd a jót, hanem tedd is.

eng: Do not expect good in return for a good deed.
Expect good in return for a good deed.
If you come, you will be (here), if you bring (food), you will eat.
hun_orig: Ha jöttök, lesztek, ha hoztok, esztek.

eng: Let it come, whatever must come.
eng_explain: 'I can/will not do anything to influence the course of events.'

eng: What Jove may do, the ox may not.
hun_orig: Amit szabad Jupiternek, nem szabad azt az ökörnek.

eng: He has (or is involved in) a coat-affair.
eng_explain: 'A man whose coat was stolen was told 'to be involved in a coat-stealing affair'.'

eng: A cadre will not be lost, only transformed.
eng_explain: 'A cadre who failed in a position, will not be sacked, only transferred to another similar post.'
hun_orig: A káder nem vész el, csak átalakul.

eng: He seeks a knot even on the (bal)rush.
Every cock is master upon his own dunghill.
hun_orig: Minden kakas úr a maga szemétdombján.

eng: One cannot put everything under one that.
eng_explain: 'One cannot consider things/ideas identical/equal which are in fact different.'
hun_orig: Nem lehet mindent egy kalap alá venni.

eng: Everyone greets others with a hat he has got.
hun_orig: Kinek milyen kalapja van, olyannal köszön.

eng: An empty ear (of corn) holds its "head" upright.
hun_orig: Üres kalász fenn tartja a fejét.

eng: An empty pantry has a fool housewife.
He would drown him in a spoonful of water.
He is a spoon in all liquids.
eng_explain: (He has a finger in every pie.)

eng: He draws everything to one (to the same) last.
There is no loss, which is not a gain for somebody.
hun_orig: Nincs az a kár, mely valakinek ne használna.

eng: Black Christmas white Easter.
If your sword is short, add one step to it.
eng_explain: 'A missing part may be substituted sometimes by something else, e.g. skill.'
hun_orig: Ha rövid a kardod, toldd meg egy lépéssel.

eng: Two sharp swords/daggers cannot be is one sheath.
hun_orig: Két éles kard/tőr nem fér meg egy hüvelyben.

eng: It goes like cuts of a whip.
eng_explain: (It goes like clockwork.)

eng: He plays with open cards.
He whose mouth was once burned by hot mush, blows even at sour milk.
hun_orig: Kinek egyszer megégette száját a kása, az aludttejet is megfújja.

eng: Mush/Soup is not eaten as hot as it is cooked.
eng_explain: (The devil is not so black as he is painted.)
hun_orig: Nem eszik a kását/levest olyan forrón, ahogy főzik.

eng: It's easy to take Kati to the dance (if she is also willing).
hun_orig: Könnyű Katit táncba vinni (ha ő is akarja).

eng: He looks for a needle in a bundle (of hay).
Both the goat has enough to eat and the cabbage remains.
hun_orig: A kecske is jóllakik és a káposzta is megmarad.

eng: Without driving even a goat would not go to the market.
hun_orig: A kecske se menne a vásárra, ha nem hajtanák.

eng: Even on old goat likes to lick salt.
eng_explain: 'Even old men like making love.'
hun_orig: A vén kecske is megnyalja a sót.

eng: He likes it as a goat likes the knife (that kills him).
hun_orig: Úgy szereti, mint a kecske a kést.

eng: He confides the cabbage to the goat.
He drinks like a brushmaker.
eng_explain: (He drinks like a fish.)

eng: He combines the pleasant with the useful.
We shall write it in soot in the chimney.
eng_explain: 'We may write it off.'

eng: The developments have led to the breaking of bread (i. e. the breaking of former relations).
Like question, like answer.
hun_orig: Amilyen a kérdés, olyan a felelet.

eng: It is better to ask twice than to err once.
hun_orig: Jobb kétszer kérdezni, mint egyszer hibázni.

eng: The wheel turns better if greased.
hun_orig: A kerék is jobban forog, ha kenik.

eng: He that seeks, finds.
He removes the baptismal water from somebody.
eng_explain: (He curses somebody up and down.)

eng: What is delayed may come/happen later.
It was baked/fried too late.
eng_explain: 'It was done too late.'

eng: Better late than never.
I shall teach you to pipe into gloves.
eng_explain: 'I shall tech you how to behave.'

eng: One hand washes the other.
The right hand does not know what the left is doing.
eng_explain: 'An uncoordinated or careless action.'
hun_orig: Nem tudja a jobb kéz, mit csinál a bal.

eng: Many hands are quickly ready (with the work).
He washes his hand.
A good beginning is half success.
Every beginning is hard.
For an onlooker/bystander nothing is precious.
Many a little becomes much.
We do not care for the little and the great is of no importance (for us).
hun_orig: Kicsire nem adunk/nézünk, a nagy meg nem számít.

eng: A good excuse is never bad.
eng_explain: 'It is always good to have a good excuse, if it serves the purpose.'

eng: Whom a serpent has bitten, is afraid of a lizard.
hun_orig: Kit a kígyó megcsíp, a gyíktól is fél.

eng: He shouts snake and frog at somebody.
eng_explain: 'To abuse somebody right and left.'

eng: A king(dom) of Whitsuntide.
eng_explain: 'A glory/honour of short duration.'

eng: The little devil is hiding in me.
eng_explain: 'In spite of what was shown/told me, I have some serious doubts.'

eng: What you do not wish for yourself, do not do it to your fellow-men either.
hun_orig: Amit nem kívánsz magadnak, te se tedd embertársadnak.

eng: The exception confirms the rule.
Long sausage and short sermon are good.
hun_orig: Jó a hosszú kolbász és a rövid prédikáció.

eng: A shy beggar has an empty scrip.
It is an egg of Columbus.
eng_explain: 'It is a problem very easy to solve.'

eng: You (try to) trade at a deserted place.
He shaves a bald head.
eng_explain: 'A useless action.'

eng: He who mixes with the bran, will be eaten by the pigs.
hun_orig: Aki korpa közé keveredik, megeszik a disznók.

eng: The pitcher goes so long to the well, until it breaks.
hun_orig: Addig jár a korsó a kútra, míg el nem törik.

eng: One blacksmith envies another.
A great stone fell down from his heart.
eng_explain: 'A sense of relief as a danger or worry was averted.'
hun_orig: Nagy kő esett le a szívéről.

eng: A stone moved often gathers no moss.
hun_orig: Nem mohosodik az a kő meg, melyet gyakran mozgatnak.

eng: If a stone was thrown at you, throw back some bread in return.
hun_orig: Ha megdobnak kővel, dobd vissza kenyérrel.

eng: They blow one stone.
eng_explain: 'They have the same bad intentions.'

eng: He moves all the stones (to achieve something).
Bread borrowed should be returned.
eng_explain: (Tit for tat.)

eng: There is some trouble in Köpec.
eng_explain: 'There is something wrong there.'

eng: He turns his coat (according to the wind).
Work is burning down to his nail.
eng_explain: 'He is hard pressed for time.'

eng: If all cords break.
eng_explain: 'If the worst comes to the worst.'

eng: He who is a friend of Christ, will soon find salvation.
hun_orig: Kinek Krisztus a barátja, könnyen üdvözül.

eng: Even Christ's coffin was not guarded for nothing.
You may go to Kukutyin to sharpen oats.
eng_explain: 'You are not needed any more, you may/should leave.'

eng: Scrape you "short man", and you will also have.
eng_explain: 'Making more efforts you will finally gain something.' (Usually a scornful remark.)

eng: The dog barks but the caravan goes on.
hun_orig: A kutya ugat, a karaván halad.

eng: A dog that barks does not bite.
hun_orig: Amelyik kutya ugat, az nem harap.

eng: One of them is a dog, the other a "barker".
eng_explain: 'They are equally bad.'

eng: The dog is buried here.
eng_explain: (Here lies the rub.)

eng: A living dog is better than a dead lion.
hun_orig: Jobb az élő kutya a holt oroszlánnál.

eng: Dog and cat friendship.
A scalded dog fears even the rain.
hun_orig: Leforrázott kutya az esőtől is fél.

eng: There is not only one pied dog in the world.
hun_orig: Nemcsak egy tarka kutya van a világon.

eng: A red (haired) dog, a red (haired) horse, a red (haired) man - none of them are good.
hun_orig: Vörös kutya, vörös ló, vörös ember egy se jó.

eng: Out of a dog there will be no lard.
eng_explain: (A leopard cannot change his spots.)

eng: He is the kid of our dog.
eng_explain: 'A child of somebody related to the speaker, who was granted - or will be granted - preferential treatment at the expense of outsiders.'

eng: If a dog is to be killed, it is said to be mad.
hun_orig: Amely kutyát meg akarnak ölni, veszett nevét költik.

eng: The bite of a dog is healed by the hair of it.
Barking of dogs cannot be heard in heaven.
eng_explain: 'Who cares about what he says.'

eng: He got out of the bed with the left leg.
eng_explain: (To get out of the bed on the wrong side.)

eng: It's hard to dance in chains.
I tell my daughter, my daughter-in-law should understand it.
He adds one more shovelful of it. (It was bad but his action made it even worse.)
Go slowly, you get farther.
Appearance cheats.
A lad on the dam.
eng_explain: 'He is not frightened/deterred by difficulties.'

eng: The smart lad is not him who beats, but he who endures it.
hun_orig: Nem az a legény, aki üti, hanem aki állja.

eng: He builds castles in the air.
He kills two flies with one flap.
One can do anything, only will is needed.
There is no impossibility, only unwillingness/incapacity.
His soul comes to him only to sleep there.
eng_explain: 'He is in very bad health.'
hun_orig: Csak hálni jár bele a lélek.

eng: It will be what will be.
eng_explain: (Be as be may.)

eng: The black soup is still ahead.
eng_explain: 'The worst is still to come.'

eng: The soup costs more than the meat.
eng_explain: 'The production of something costs more than the value of the product.'
hun_orig: Többe kerül a leves, mint a hús.

eng: He fell to the other side of the horse.
eng_explain: 'From one extreme he switched to the opposite extreme.'

eng: This is a 'veterinary horse'.
eng_explain: 'It is like the horse in the collection of a veterinary college, demonstrating all conceivable illnesses.'

eng: If there is no horse, a donkey will do as well.
hun_orig: Ha ló nincs, a szamár is jó.

eng: The horse should worry, he has a big head.
eng_explain: 'Don't worry!'
hun_orig: Nagy a feje, búsuljon a ló.

eng: The horse has four legs, still he stumbles.
hun_orig: A lónak négy lába van, mégis megbotlik.

eng: The common horse has scars on his back.
The mouth of a treading horse is not muzzled.
hun_orig: Nyomtató lónak nem kötik be a száját.

eng: He puts on the right/wrong horse.
eng_explain: 'His decision/affiliation is right/wrong.'

eng: He threw the reins between the horses.
eng_explain: 'He refused to carry on in a leading position.'
hun_orig: A lovak közé dobta a gyeplőt.

eng: He who digs a pit for the horse of another man, will find his own horse's neck broken there.
hun_orig: Ki a más ember lovának vermet ás, az önnön lovának nyaka szakad bele.

eng: The horse that draws better is beaten (to draw even more).
hun_orig: Azt a lovat ütik, amelyik jobban húz.

eng: He tries to find his horse and is riding it.
hun_orig: A lovát keresi s rajta ül.

eng: The horse's leg protrudes.
eng_explain: (The concealed real intention comes to the open.)

eng: It is made as (or as slowly as) the stool of St. Lucy's day.
hun_orig: Úgy, lassan készül, mint a Luca széke.

eng: If it is a goose, it should be a fat one.
eng_explain: 'Somebody having an unexpected opportunity, makes the best possible use of it.'

eng: Many geese overpower a pig.
Stop up the hole until it's small.
hun_orig: Addig dugd be a lyukat, míg kicsi.

eng: He fills one hole with another.
eng_explain: He pays one debt from another loan.
hun_orig: Az egyik lyukat a másikkal tömi/dugja be.

eng: He talks a hole into the belly of somebody.
eng_explain: (He talks one's head off.)

eng: Do not put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
hun_orig: Amit ma megtehetsz, ne halaszd holnapra.

eng: Today to me, tomorrow to you.
The cat also likes fish but keeps away from water.
hun_orig: A macska is szereti a halat, de kerüli a vizet.

eng: A sly cat makes a big jump.
If the cat's away, the mice will dance/squeak.
hun_orig: Ha nincs otthon a macska, táncolnak/cincognak az egerek.

eng: He goes around it like a cat goes around hot mush.
hun_orig: Kerülgeti , mint macska a forró kását.

eng: He plays with somebody as a cat plays with a mouse.
hun_orig: Úgy játszik vele, mint macska az egérrel.

eng: It is an ugly bird that defiles its own nest.
hun_orig: Csúnya madár, amelyik a saját fészkébe piszkít.

eng: A bird is recognised by her feathers, a man by his friend.
If you want something, go yourself, if not, send somebody else.
hun_orig: Ha kell, menj magad, ha nem kell, küldj mást.

eng: Do it yourself sir, if you have not servant.
In judging others, the point of departure is always himself.
He who climbs high, has a great fall.
They are as far apart as Makó (in Hungary) is from Jerusalem.
hun_orig: Olyan messze van tőle, mint Makó Jeruzsálemtől.

eng: Where pig is proffered, go round with a sack.
hun_orig: Hol malacot ígérnek, ott zsákkal forgolódjál.

eng: They grind in two mills.
eng_explain: 'They speak of different things.'

eng: He drives the water to the mill of somebody.
eng_explain: 'By his action - unintentionally - he plays into the hands of somebody.'
hun_orig: Valakinek a malmára hajtja a vizet.

eng: He is ground between two millstones.
eng_explain: 'He tries to satisfy two incompatible requirements.'

eng: He lives like Marci in Heves.
eng_explain: (He lives like a lord.)

eng: He who grasps much, retains but little.
Kings Matthias is dead, justice is lost.
hun_orig: Meghalt Mátyás király, oda az igazság.

eng: Do not drink (i.e. rejoice) in advance on the hide of a bear (still at large).
hun_orig: Ne igyál előre a medve bőrére.

eng: Either he gets accustomed or he escapes.
What fails to succeed, should not be forced.
hun_orig: Ami nem megy, nem kell erőltetni.

eng: You haven't yet caught the bird, still you are already plucking her.
eng_explain: (Do not count your chicken before they are hatched.)
hun_orig: Meg sem fogtad s már melleszted/kopasztod.

eng: He was thrown into deep water.
eng_explain: 'After a short training he was immediately given a difficult task.'

eng: The bride is too beautiful.
eng_explain: (This news is too good to be true.)

eng: He who ventures, wins.
Measure twice, cut but once.
He that is not a master of something, is a butcher of it.
hun_orig: Ki minek nem mestere, hóhéra az annak.

eng: Every man should practise only his trade.
A man coming from far away tells us what he wants.
eng_explain: (A traveller may lie with authority.)
hun_orig: Messziről jött ember azt mond, amit akar.

eng: He pulls the honeyed string before him (or before his nose).
eng_explain: (He holds out a carrot to somebody.)
hun_orig: Elhúzza előtte vagy az orra előtt a mézesmadzagot.

eng: More was lost at Mohács.
eng_explain: 'Do not worry, this is not a serious loss/trouble.'

eng: If the mountain will not go to Mahomet, Mahomet will go to mountain.
hun_orig: Ha a hegy nem megy Mohamedhez, Mohamed megy a hegyhez.

eng: I tell you one thing, two will result from it.
eng_explain: 'I have a good idea.'

eng: I'll say such things that I'll regret even myself.
hun_orig: Olyat mondok, hogy magam is megbánom.

eng: The Moor has done his duty, the Moor may go.
hun_orig: A mór megtette a kötelességét, a mór mehet.

eng: Like wash-basin, like towel.
hun_orig: Amilyen a mosdó, olyan a törölköző.

eng: He defends the honour of the uniform.
eng_explain: 'He tries to justify/explain a mistaken/incorrect/unlawful action of somebody in his organisation/group.'

eng: The works praises its master.
Work is burning under his hand.
eng_explain: (He works like fury.)
hun_orig: Ég a keze alatt a munka.

eng: He would attend the funeral of labour.
eng_explain: 'He is utterly reluctant to work.'

eng: A hasty work is seldom good.
For good work time is needed.
After work rest is sweet.
He who is sitting in the reeds, makes a whistle of his choice.
hun_orig: Aki a nád között ül, olyan sípot csinál, amilyet akar.

eng: One has to tighten the belt.
Anything big is small at the beginning.
Nothing is new under the sun.
There are more days than sausages.
eng_explain: 'One has to save for the times ahead.'

eng: Praise the day (only) at sunset.
Even a quadruped stumbles.
He does not yield from the 48.
Unwillingness ends in groaning.
eng_explain: 'Unwillingness must lead to failure.'

eng: Even something light is heavy for the unwilling.
hun_orig: A könnyű is nehéz a nemakarónak.

eng: The voice of the people is the voice of God.
Coward people have no homeland.
He laughs really/best who laughs last.
hun_orig: Az nevet igazán/legjobban, aki utoljára nevet.

eng: Do not look for something, where it isn't.
What does not exist, cannot cause any trouble.
eng_explain: 'It is better to do nothing.'
hun_orig: Ami nincs, abból nem lehet baj.

eng: He who does not collect in summer, will heat little in winter.
hun_orig: Aki nyáron nem gyűjt, télen keveset fűt.

eng: One cannot sit in two saddles having one arse/bottom only.
hun_orig: Egy fenékkel/seggel két nyerget nem lehet megülni.

eng: An arrow once shot is hard to get back.
eng_explain: (A word once spoken is past recalling.)

eng: He who hunts two hares, does not catch even one.
hun_orig: Ki két nyulat hajt, egyet se fog.

eng: He makes the hare spring out of the bush.
eng_explain: (To make somebody show his true colours.)

eng: He did not shoot the hare but the pot is already on the fire.
hun_orig: Még a nyulat meg sem lőtte, a fazekat már a tűzhöz tette.

eng: We have seen a hare, we shall have no luck.
eng_explain: 'A superstition.'

eng: Wise men learn by others' harm.
The wiser gives in.
He pours oil on the fire.
They are as many as the Russians.
eng_explain: (There are too many of them.)
hun_orig: Annyian/Olyan sokan vannak, mint az oroszok.

eng: The whip cracks at the end.
eng_explain: 'The punishment comes at the end.'

eng: A ox remains an ox even if driven to Vienna.
eng_explain: (Send a fool to the market (far, to France) and a fool he will return again.)
hun_orig: Az ökör csak ökör, ha Bécsbe hajtják is.

eng: It is easy to push a cart drawn by twelve oxen.
hun_orig: Könnyű tizenkét ökör után eltolni egy szekeret.

eng: An ox can be taken by his horn, a man by his word.
hun_orig: Ökröt a szarván, embert a szaván lehet megfogni.

eng: For a thirsty ox dirty water will do as well.
hun_orig: Szomjas ökörnek a zavaros víz is jó.

eng: Self-praise stinks.
The devil does not sleep.
Let the devil take you!
He is afraid of it, as the devil fears holy water (or incense).
hun_orig: Fél tőle, mint ördög a szenteltvíztől/tömjéntől.

eng: The devil is not so black as he is painted.
hun_orig: Nem olyan fekete az ördög, mint amilyennek festik.

eng: The devil is beating his wife.
eng_explain: 'If it rains when the sun is shining then it is told that'

eng: Living with a devil, you have to turn a devil.
hun_orig: Ha ördöggel lakol, ördöggé kell lenned.

eng: Give the devil your little finger, you will be taken entirely.
hun_orig: Add az ördögnek kisujjadat, egészen elkap.

eng: Sometimes one has to light a candle for the devil too.
hun_orig: Az ördögnek is kell olykor gyertyát gyújtani.

eng: He owed the devil a journey.
eng_explain: 'He made a journey in vain.'

eng: He is good, only the devils are bad, for not carrying him away.
hun_orig: Jó, csak az ördögök rosszak, hogy el nem viszik.

eng: It is not good to paint the devil on the wall (as he will appear).
hun_orig: Nem jó az ördögöt a falra festeni.

eng: It is good to have an old man at home.
There is no joy without sorrow.
He was left behind like the Wallachians by St. Paul.
eng_explain: 'He was left behind unexpectedly.'
hun_orig: Otthagyta, mint Szent Pál az oláhokat.

eng: A good priest learns until his death.
Not even the priest will speak/preach twice.
One likes the priest, someone else his wife (I prefer his daughter).
hun_orig: Kinek a pap, kinek a papné (nekem a lánya).

eng: Paper is patient.
It is not all/always mallow.
eng_explain: (Life is not all beer and skittles.)

eng: If the shepherds fight each other, the wolf has a good time.
hun_orig: Verekedő pásztorok közt jó dolga van a farkasnak.

eng: Friday is longer than Saturday.
eng_explain: 'The underskirt is longer than the skirt.'
hun_orig: Hosszabb a péntek, mint a szombat.

eng: Little money - little football.
eng_explain: 'If little money is paid, then only little work can be expected.'

eng: Money talks, although the dog may bark.
Bad money is never lost.
eng_explain: (A bad penny always turns up.)

eng: Money has no smell.
He is well known as bad money.
He got into this affair like Pilate into the Credo (i. e. by mere chance).
hun_orig: Úgy került bele, mint Pilátus a krédóba.

eng: Even the highway leading to Hell is paved with good intentions.
hun_orig: A pokol országútja is jó szándékkal van kikövezve.

eng: Hell has been broken loose.
There is a feast once even in Hell.
hun_orig: Pokolban is esik egyszer egy ünnep.

eng: He puts the dot on the i.
eng_explain: 'He makes the last move in the completion of something.'

eng: Punctuality is the politeness of kings.
Nobody is a prophet in his own country.
hun_orig: Senki sem próféta a saját, maga hazájában.

eng: An unwanted helper gets (dog's) droppings as payment.
The proof of the pudding is eating it.
hun_orig: A puding próbája az, hogy megeszik.

eng: This is but a hump on our backs.
eng_explain: 'We would be pleased to get rid of this.'

eng: Order is the soul of everything.
There must be order.
A lazy man works twice.
Radish is poison in the morning, food at noon and medicine in the evening.
hun_orig: A retek reggel méreg, délben étek, este orvosság.

eng: What he gains at the toll, loses at the customs.
hun_orig: Amit nyer a réven, elveszti a vámon.

eng: A sleeping fox catches no hare/chicken.
One cannot strip two hides from one fox.
hun_orig: Egy rókáról két bőrt nem lehet lehúzni.

eng: All roads lead to Rome.
It is easier to destroy than to build.
It is bad with the bad (i. e. the wife), but it is worse without the bad.
hun_orig: Rossz a rosszal, de rosszabb a rossz nélkül.

eng: The worse it is (in one respect), the better (in another respect).
No rose without a thorn.
Clothes do not make the man.
hun_orig: Nem a ruha teszi az embert.

eng: Clothes make the man.
He stands the mud.
eng_explain: 'He comes up to mark. - He stands the test.'

eng: He dismounts the tent-poles.
eng_explain: 'He makes off.'

eng: Even if the wound is healed, the scar of it remains.
hun_orig: Ha begyógyul is a seb, megmarad a helye.

eng: It is easy to inflict a wound, but difficult to heal it.
hun_orig: Könnyű sebet ejteni, de nehéz gyógyítani.

eng: Even a little is more than nothing.
hun_orig: A semminél a kevés is többet ér.

eng: Here is nothing, hold it tight.
eng_explain: 'Somebody was given much less than expected.'

eng: Out of nothing there will be nothing.
A new broom sweeps well.
He that hurries will be late.
Headman Simon drives the horse.
eng_explain: 'The woman rules the house.'

eng: He has already one foot in the grave.
He turns/spins in his grave.
He became in idol of salt.
eng_explain: (A pillar of salt.)

eng: It has never been so, that it wouldn't have been anyhow.
hun_orig: Úgy még sohasem volt, hogy valahogy ne lett volna.

eng: He may go to the salt-office.
eng_explain: 'His case will not be heard anywhere.'

eng: He who begins many things, finished but few.
A falcon will not breed a dove.
hun_orig: A sólyommadárnak nem lesz galamb fia.

eng: He reads between the lines.
He sticks out of the line.
eng_explain: (He steps out of the line.)

eng: He has discovered the sealing wax.
eng_explain: 'He made an invention done by others long ago.'

eng: He takes/hands over the baton.
eng_explain: 'He takes/hands over a job from to his predecessor/successor.'

eng: Sheepskin coat to sheepskin coat, (shepherd's) cloth coat to cloth coat.
eng_explain: 'Marry your equal.'

eng: He throws the beater too far.
eng_explain: (He throws the hatchet.)

eng: Let the shoemaker remain at his last!
There is a dialogue between deaf people.
eng_explain: 'Each tells his own views without regard to that of the other.'

eng: Liberty is dearer than gold.
There is no rule without exception.
His mouth is as big as the Vienna Gate (in Buda).
hun_orig: Akkora a szája, mint a Bécsi kapu.

eng: Don't speak my mouth, I shall have no headache.
hun_orig: Ne szólj szám, nem fáj fejem!

eng: Many cooks put too much salt in the soup/food.
hun_orig: Sok szakács elsózza a levest (az ételt).

eng: It is a splinter in the eye of somebody.
eng_explain: (A thorn in the flesh.)

eng: Give lodgement to a Slovak and you will be beaten out of your home.
hun_orig: Adj a tótnak szállást, kiver a házból.

eng: A drowning man catches even at a stalk of straw.
hun_orig: A fuldokló ember a szalmaszálhoz is kap.

eng: He does not put crosswise even one stalk of straw.
eng_explain: 'He is utterly lazy/disinterested in this matter.'

eng: He stands there like a donkey on the hill.
eng_explain: 'He is idle/undecided what to do.'

eng: He disappeared like a grey donkey in the fog.
hun_orig: Eltűnt, mint szürke szamár a ködben.

eng: Braying of an ass (or barking of a dog), is not heard in Heaven.
hun_orig: Szamárbőgés/Ebugatás nem hallatszik a mennybe/az égbe.

eng: One should not stir the shit (as it will be even more stinking).
hun_orig: Nem kell keverni a szart (mert még büdösebb lesz).

eng: The magpie rattles, a guest will come.
The magpie wants too much, but her tail is unable to carry it.
eng_explain: 'He overestimates his power/capacity/strength.'
hun_orig: Sokat akar a szarka, de nem bírja a farka.

eng: He has hit the udder between the horns.
eng_explain: 'He has made a bad mistake.'

eng: Nail by/with nail.
eng_explain: (One nail drives out another.)

eng: A poor man is pulled even by the branch of a tree.
hun_orig: A szegény embert még az ág is húzza.

eng: A poor man cooks with water.
Even the luck of a poor man is poor.
Between two chairs he falls below the bench.
hun_orig: Két szék közt a pad alá esik.

eng: Sing the song of the man whose cart you sit on.
hun_orig: Akinek a szekerén ülsz, annak a nótáját fújjad.

eng: The pole of his cart is pointing outwards.
eng_explain: (He is about to get the sack.)

eng: Do not run after a cart that will not take you.
hun_orig: Ne fuss olyan szekér után, amelyik nem vesz fel.

eng: There is no loaded cart which could not carry one more forkful (of hay).
hun_orig: Nincs oly rakott szekér, melyre még egy villával ne férne.

eng: He who sows wind, reaps whirlwind.
He takes the wind out of someone's sails.
One cannot fight the wind.
He turns like a weathercock.
He released the spirit from the bottle.
He fights windmills.
Several eyes see more.
What is noticed by his eyes, will not be left there by his hands.
hun_orig: Amit a szeme meglát, a keze nem hagyja ott.

eng: His eyes are beautiful, but his heart is a devil.
hun_orig: Szép a szeme, de ördög a szíve.

eng: He guards it/him like his eyesight.
hun_orig: Úgy vigyáz rá, mint a szeme fényére/világára.

eng: (He can see the splinter in another's eye but cannot see even the beam in his own.)
hun_orig: Más szemében a szálkát is meglátja, a magáéban a gerendát sem.

eng: One of my eyes sheds tears, the other one laughs.
hun_orig: Egyik szemem sír, a másik meg nevet.

eng: The world stands to those who have eyes.
eng_explain: 'To the open eyes the world yields anything.'

eng: An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth.
He puts out the eye of somebody with something.
eng_explain: 'He gives something of much less value than requested/needed/promised.'

eng: More credit is given to the eyes than to the ears.
hun_orig: Többet hiszünk a szemnek, mint a fülnek.

eng: He is as impertinent as a fly at the market.
His hay is in order.
eng_explain: 'Everything is all right about him.'

eng: The hand of each saint inclines towards himself.
hun_orig: Minden szentnek maga felé hajlik a keze.

eng: He hangs out the dirty linen (to the public).
Love is blind.
Everyone is the blacksmith of his own fortune.
Goo tool means half the work.
A new sieve is on a nail (then it gets under the bed).
hun_orig: Új szita szegen függ (aztán az ágy alá kerül).

eng: What is on his heart, that is on his mouth/tongue.
hun_orig: Ami a szívén, az a száján/nyelvén.

eng: Nice words appease even the enemy.
hun_orig: A szép szó az ellenséget is kibékíti.

eng: Only words that have been told can be understood.
Even one hundred words lead to one end.
hun_orig: Száz szónak is egy a vége.

eng: His words are nice but he is a devil (his liver is that of a devil).
hun_orig: Szép a szava, de ördög ő maga (az eha [mája]).

eng: The room and the stove are one item.
eng_explain: 'Man and wife share the same responsibilities.'
hun_explain: "A férj és a feleség egyaránt felelős közös dolgaikért."

eng: The neighbour's meadow is always greener.
A good neighbour is better than many bad kinsmen.
hun_orig: Jobb a jó szomszéd sok rossz atyafinál.

eng: The nail sticks out of the sack.
eng_explain: 'One's real intention/purpose comes to the open.'

eng: It hit a nail into his head.
eng_explain: 'It set him thinking.'

eng: The grape is sour.
He sweeps the problem under the carpet.
hun_orig: A szőnyeg alá söpri a kérdést/problémát.

eng: He makes an elephant out of a mosquito.
He forges/makes a virtue of necessity.
Where need is great, help is nearby.
hun_orig: Ahol nagy a szükség, közel a segítség.

eng: Necessity breaks the law.
It was a difficult childbirth.
eng_explain: 'It was very difficult to achieve it e. g. in a discussion.'

eng: His cloak was put out.
eng_explain: (He got the sack.)

eng: Stretch yourself as far as your cover reaches.
hun_orig: Addig nyújtózz, ameddig a takaród ér.

eng: Dish and spoon cannot be without jingling.
eng_explain: 'It is natural to have some disagreement between man and wife.'

eng: He treads downwards [on his subordinates] and bows upwards [before his superiors].
All cows are black in the dark.
Even a heavy burden is light if lifted by many.
hun_orig: A nagy teher is könnyű, ha sokan emelik.

eng: It will soon show which milk will yield a good curd.
eng_explain: 'A child's character and abilities become evident soon.'
hun_orig: Korán meglátszik, mely tejből lesz jó túró.

eng: It is not all sour cream down to the bottom.
eng_explain: 'It is not all as good as it seems to be.'

eng: He is as poor as a church mouse.
Facts are stubborn things.
To err is human.
Take what is yours, [but] not that of others.
hun_orig: Ami tiéd, tedd el, a másét ne vedd el.

eng: Learn steer, you will turn an ox.
eng_explain: 'Keep studying hard, so that you may get on in life.'

eng: Cleanliness is half-health.
One of them is nineteen, the other is one less than twenty.
eng_explain: 'They are equally bad.'
hun_orig: Egyik tizenkilenc, a másik egy híján húsz.

eng: He boasts with foreign feathers.
The great thief escapes (the gallow), the small one hangs.
hun_orig: A nagy tolvaj leszakad, de a kicsi felakad.

eng: The midwife should have cut his throat rather than his navel.
hun_orig: Jobb a torkát metszette volna meg a bába, mikor köldökét metszette meg.

eng: He does not even know whether it is a pumpkin or a curd-cake.
eng_explain: 'He has no idea about it.'
hun_orig: Azt se tudja tök-e vagy túrós étek.

eng: It is like throwing bur on a gourd.
eng_explain: 'A vain effort.'

eng: The wind fells the oak, but cannot cope with the reed.
hun_orig: Szél a tölgyet ledönti, de a náddal nem bír.

eng: He threw in the towel.
eng_explain: (He gave up the effort.)

eng: Truth may be told in a joke too.
Knowledge is power.
Patience brings roses.
eng_explain: (All things come to those who wait.)

eng: He is between two fires.
He who is close to the fire, will get warm best.
hun_orig: Aki közel van a tűzhöz, az jobban melegszik.

eng: It is not good to play with the fire.
He is doing a fireman's work.
eng_explain: 'He is compelled to do something quickly, without proper preparation and consideration.'

eng: A hen that cackles much lays only a few eggs.
hun_orig: Amelyik tyúk sokat kotkodácsol, keveset tojik.

eng: He knows as much about it as a hen does about the alphabet.
hun_orig: Annyit ért hozzá, mint tyúk az ábécéhez.

eng: Truth is scraped out even by a hen.
hun_orig: Az igazságot a tyúk is kikaparja.

eng: Even a blind hen can find a grain.
It will not last longer than frying an egg.
Today (it is enough to do it) by one finger, tomorrow (it will be necessary) by ten nails.
hun_orig: Máma egy ujjal, holnap tíz körömmel.

eng: Even our fingers are not equal.
"Régen rossz annak, aki feljebbvalójával vitába száll."
eng_explain: God is the doctor of the man who quarrels with his master.
hun_orig: Aki urával pöröl, Isten annak orvosa.

eng: A master is a master in hell as well.
hun_orig: Az úr a pokolban is úr.

eng: A master's request is a command.
It is not good to eat cherries from the same dish with persons of high rank.
hun_orig: Nem jó nagy urakkal egy tálból cseresznyézni.

eng: One cannot (It is difficult to) serve two masters.
Give me, my Lord, but do it immediately.
eng_explain: 'An urgent request.'

eng: There is a way upwards and downwards too.
eng_explain: 'Leave immediately.'
hun_orig: Fel is út, le is út.

eng: The straight (i. e. honest) road is the best.
Don't leave the betrodden way for the untrodden one.
hun_orig: Járt utat a járatlanért el ne hagyd!

eng: He has passed the road to Damascus.
eng_explain: 'He has changed his conviction or allegiance.'

eng: He gets green way.
eng_explain: (He gets green light.)

eng: Property gained unlawfully will be lost in the same way.
hun_orig: Ebül szerzett vagyon ebül vész el.

eng: He who has butter on his head, should not go to the sun.
hun_orig: Akinek vaj van a fején, ne menjen a napra.

eng: A blind leads a sightless.
Among the blind the one-eyed is the king.
hun_orig: A vakok közt félszemű a király.

eng: Something is better than nothing.
Something for something.
eng_explain: (Tit for tat.)

eng: Let the cobbler Paul grumble, he should only make good sandals.
hun_orig: Hadd morogjon Varga Pál, csak jó sarut varrjon.

eng: Cobbler, do not go beyond the last.
He who wants to shoot at a crow, will not pluck his bow.
hun_orig: Aki varjat akar lőni, nem pengeti íját.

eng: Against a thousand crows one stone is enough.
hun_orig: Ezer varjú ellen elég egy kő.

eng: I have already seen a crow on a pole.
eng_explain: 'I do not believe this boasting/exaggeration/menace.'

eng: A crow does not pick out the crow's eye.
hun_orig: Varjú a varjúnak nem vágja ki a szemét.

eng: Strike the iron while it is warm.
hun_orig: Addig üsd a vasat, míg meleg.

eng: He keeps two/several irons in the fire.
The agreement depends on two persons.
He seizes the lighter end of the matter.
hun_orig: A könnyebb végét fogja a dolognak.

eng: He does not hide his opinion under a bushel.
hun_orig: Nem rejti véka alá a véleményét.

eng: If I say, it is pregnant, if I do not say, it is not pregnant.
eng_explain: 'It depends on me whether I decide this or another way.'
eng_explain2: or 'I cannot see any good reason for deciding this or that way either'.
hun_orig: Ha akarom vemhes, ha akarom, nem vemhes.

eng: Even the most welcome guest is more than enough for three days.
hun_orig: Akármilyen kedves vendég, három napig untig elég.

eng: After three days the palace of the guest is behind the door (i. e. outside).
hun_orig: Harmadnapi vendégnek ajtó megett a helye.

eng: The place of an unbidden guest is behind the door.
Blood will not turn water.
Even the sparrows chirp it.
eng_explain: 'It is an open secret.'

eng: Better a sparrow today than a bustard tomorrow.
hun_orig: Jobb ma egy veréb, mint holnap egy túzok.

eng: He who digs a pit for others, falls into it himself.
hun_orig: Aki másnak vermet ás, maga esik bele.

eng: A beaten one carries an unbeaten.
eng_explain: 'The innocent has to suffer for the crime of a wrong-doer.'

eng: As one sows, so he reaps.
A storm in a glass of water.
If Vincent begins to flow, then the cellar will be full.
eng_explain: 'If the thaw sets in on Vincent day, then there will be much wine in the autumn.'
hun_orig: Ha megcsordul Vince, tele lesz a pince.

eng: Slow water washes away the bank.
He is (not) like water shaking in a wash tub.
eng_explain: 'He is (not) turning his coat according to the wind.'
hun_orig: (Nem) Olyan, mint a teknőben ingó víz.

eng: Much water will flow in the Danube until then.
eng_explain: 'It is still far away.'
hun_orig: Sok víz lefolyik még addig a Dunán.

eng: Much water has run in the Danube since then.
eng_explain: 'It happened long ago.'
hun_orig: Sok víz lefolyt azóta a Dunán.

eng: He preaches water and drinks wine.
He could not earn enough to buy even cold water.
eng_explain: 'If really efficient work were requested, then his work would not earn him cold water.'
hun_orig: A hideg vízre valót sem keresné meg.

eng: He that is afraid of water, will not eat fish.
hun_orig: Aki fél a víztől, nem eszik halat.

eng: He fishes in troubled waters.
The sack has found its patch.
eng_explain: 'People of the same similar ideas have found each other.'

eng: 'He sells/buys a cat in a poke.'
